data.headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq, Dow, and Russell 2000 all closed with fractional gains after late-day buying lifted markets.
bullets: Megacap growth and AI-driven tech stocks remained under pressure amid ongoing software sector jitters.
Financials and big banks provided support, helping stabilize broader indices.
ZIM Integrated Shipping surged after a $4.2B buyout bid fueled deal-related momentum.
Paramount/Skydance and Warner Bros. Discovery rallied on renewed M&A enthusiasm.
Notable movers included Apple, GE, Masimo, Danaher, Rivian, Norwegian Cruise Line, Wingstop, biotechs, Ormat Technologies (on a Google geothermal pact), and Palantir (on Miami HQ move).
Oil and gold prices eased as progress in Iranâ€“US nuclear talks reduced geopolitical risk.
No major economic data or fresh Fed commentary released, leaving traders focused on upcoming Nvidia earnings, inflation, GDP, and Fed signals for direction.
